ground_truth: Nullah stares into the distance as Sarah rides up to the house. Drover comes out the back door, and she freezes, keeping her back to him. On the porch, he turns slowly and looks at her, then walks towards Magarri and the horses as her eyes fill with tears. She whirls around and goes back indoors as he rides away. Nullah's dog attacks a cop chasing him, and he turns slowly to look into the eyes of a half-naked black tracker. Callahan finds Fletcher at the movies. King George is flung into a cell as Nullah is dragged away. Sarah drives through crowds on the wharf where troopships crowd Darwin harbor. Nullah is with a group of half-caste children being shipped out as his grandfather hears in his cell. Sarah drives past lines of marching troops while Nullah stares at the white boy. Troops and civilians swarm towards the wharf, and Sarah stops at a barrier and gets out of the car. Callahan drags the white boy away as a priest pulls Nullah. Crocodile boots stop in front of him, and Nullah looks up into Fletcher's face. Sarah barges her way anxiously through the crowd on the wharf as smoke rises from ships' funnels. The priest leads Nullah to a waiting boat while Fletcher observes slyly. As Sarah runs down the wharf, Nullah runs to the stern of the boat. The small boat pulls out of the shadow of the huge liners evacuating the town. The boy looks up at Sarah, and Fletcher grins. Nullah waves to Sarah, who stops at the end of the wharf. Fletcher leans on the railing next to her as the boat sails away. He turns smugly to her, grins, and saunters off. On the back of the boat, Nullah turns and looks up at a priest as Sarah leans on the wharf rail in despair, trying to control her sobs. The children's boat sails away from the wharf between huge, grey navy vessels. A Japanese fighter skims through the clouds towards an island. Sarah steps out onto the balcony and looks out over the harbor. She looks across at Drover, who's standing thoughtfully by a tree. As he whistles, Magarri stares at Drover, who looks uncomfortable and tentatively lays his hand on the tree. Magarri turns away, and tears fill Drover's eyes. Their vehicles raise a cloud of dust on the other side of the river they are camping next to. Clouds fill the sky as fighters take off at dawn from an aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits peacefully in the grey sea, beneath the cloudy sky. The children are asleep in their dormitory when Nullah wakes up with a start. Smiling unpleasantly, Fletcher hangs up the phone in his office overlooking the whole of Darwin.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Nullah gazes into the expanse as Sarah rides up to the residence. Drover emerges out the rear entrance, and she halts, maintaining her back to him. On the veranda, he pivots gradually and glances at her, then strides towards Magarri and the steeds as her eyes brim with tears. She twirls around and returns indoors as he rides away. Nullah's canine attacks a cop pursuing him, and he pivots gradually to gaze into the eyes of a half-clothed black tracker. Callahan discovers Fletcher at the cinema. King George is hurled into a cell as Nullah is dragged away. Sarah drives through throngs on the quay where troopships cram Darwin harbor. Nullah is with a group of mixed-race children being shipped out as his grandfather hears in his cell. Sarah drives past lines of marching soldiers while Nullah gazes at the white lad. Soldiers and civilians swarm towards the quay, and Sarah halts at a barricade and exits the vehicle. Callahan drags the white lad away as a clergyman pulls Nullah. Crocodile footwear halts in front of him, and Nullah looks up into Fletcher's countenance. Sarah pushes her way anxiously through the multitude on the quay as smoke rises from ships' funnels. The clergyman guides Nullah to a waiting vessel while Fletcher watches slyly. As Sarah sprints down the quay, Nullah runs to the stern of the vessel. The small vessel pulls out of the shadow of the massive liners evacuating the town. The boy looks up at Sarah, and Fletcher smirks. Nullah waves to Sarah, who halts at the end of the quay. Fletcher leans on the railing next to her as the vessel sails away. He turns smugly to her, smirks, and saunters off. On the back of the vessel, Nullah turns and looks up at a clergyman as Sarah leans on the quay rail in despair, trying to control her sobs. The children's vessel sails away from the quay between massive, grey naval ships. A Japanese aircraft skims through the clouds towards an isle. Sarah steps out onto the balcony and looks out over the harbor. She looks across at Drover, who's standing thoughtfully by a tree. As he whistles, Magarri gazes at Drover, who looks uneasy and tentatively places his hand on the tree. Magarri turns away, and tears fill Drover's eyes. Their vehicles raise a cloud of dust on the other side of the river they are camping next to. Clouds fill the sky as aircraft take off at dawn from an aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits serenely in the grey sea, beneath the overcast sky. The children are asleep in their dormitory when Nullah awakens with a start. Smiling unpleasantly, Fletcher hangs up the telephone in his office overlooking the entirety of Darwin.

test_cases.description: Nullah is stared at in the distance as the house is ridden up to by Sarah. The back door is come out of by Drover, and she is frozen by him, keeping her back turned. On the porch, he is turned to slowly and looked at by her, then Magarri and the horses are walked towards by him as her eyes are filled with tears. She whirls around and goes back indoors as he rides away. A cop chasing Nullah is attacked by Nullah's dog, and the eyes of a half-naked black tracker are looked into slowly by him. Fletcher is found at the movies by Callahan. King George flings himself into a cell as Nullah is dragged away. Crowds are driven through by Sarah on the wharf where Darwin harbor is crowded with troopships. Nullah is with a group of half-caste children who are being shipped out as his grandfather hears in his cell. Lines of marching troops are driven past by Sarah while the white boy is stared at by Nullah. The wharf is swarmed towards by troops and civilians, and a barrier is stopped at, and the car is gotten out of by Sarah. The white boy is dragged away by Callahan as Nullah is pulled by a priest. Crocodile boots stop in front of him, and Fletcher's face is looked up into by Nullah. The crowd is barged through anxiously by Sarah on the wharf as smoke is seen rising from ships' funnels. Nullah is led by the priest to a waiting boat while Fletcher slyly observes. As the wharf is run down by Sarah, the stern of the boat is run to by Nullah. The shadow of the huge liners evacuating the town is pulled out of by the small boat. Sarah is looked up at by the boy, and Fletcher grins. Sarah is waved to by Nullah, who stops at the end of the wharf. The railing next to her is leaned on by Fletcher as the boat is sailed away. He turns smugly to her, grins, and saunters off. The back of the boat is turned to and looked up at by Nullah as the wharf rail is leaned on in despair by Sarah, who tries to control her sobs. The children's boat sails away from the wharf between huge, grey navy vessels. A Japanese fighter skims through the clouds towards an island. The balcony is stepped out onto by Sarah, and the harbor is looked out over. Drover, who's standing thoughtfully by a tree, is looked across at by her. As Drover is whistled at, Magarri stares at him, who looks uncomfortable and tentatively lays his hand on the tree. Magarri turns away, and Drover's eyes are filled with tears. A cloud of dust is raised by their vehicles on the other side of the river they are camping next to. The sky is filled with clouds as fighters take off at dawn from an aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits peacefully in the grey sea, beneath the cloudy sky. The dormitory is slept in by the children when Nullah wakes up with a start. Smiling unpleasantly, the phone is hung up by Fletcher in his office overlooking the whole of Darwin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Nullah gazes into the distance as Sarah arrives at the house. Drover exits, and she freezes, avoiding him. On the porch, he turns to her, then heads to Magarri and the horses as she tears up. She spins around and goes inside as he departs. Nullah's dog attacks a cop pursuing him, and Nullah meets the eyes of a half-naked tracker. Callahan finds Fletcher at the movies. King George is jailed as Nullah is dragged away. Sarah drives through crowds at the wharf where troopships fill Darwin harbor. Nullah is among half-caste children being relocated as his grandfather hears from his cell. Sarah passes marching troops, and Nullah stares at a white boy. People head to the wharf, and Sarah stops at a barrier. Callahan takes the white boy as a priest leads Nullah. Crocodile boots stop in front of him, and he looks up at Fletcher. Sarah anxiously pushes through the crowd as smoke rises from ships. The priest leads Nullah to a boat while Fletcher watches. As Sarah runs down the wharf, Nullah moves to the boat's stern. The small boat leaves the shadow of large liners. The boy looks at Sarah, and Fletcher grins. Nullah waves to her at the wharfâ€™s end. Fletcher leans on the railing beside her as the boat departs, then smugly turns to her and walks off. On the boat, Nullah looks at a priest as Sarah leans on the wharf rail in despair, stifling sobs. The boat sails away from the wharf between navy vessels. A Japanese fighter flies toward an island. Sarah steps onto the balcony overlooking the harbor. She sees Drover by a tree. As he whistles, Magarri watches, and Drover uncomfortably touches the tree, tears in his eyes. Their vehicles stir up dust across the river they camp by. Clouds gather as fighters launch at dawn from an aircraft carrier. Mission Island rests calmly in the grey sea beneath cloudy skies. As the children sleep, Nullah wakes with a start. Fletcher, smiling unpleasantly, hangs up the phone in his office overlooking Darwin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Nullah stares into the distance as Sarah approaches the house. Drover emerges, and Sarah freezes, turning away. On the porch, Drover glances at her, then moves toward Magarri and the horses as Sarah tearfully heads inside while he departs. Nullah's dog attacks a pursuing cop, and Nullah faces a half-naked black tracker. Callahan finds Fletcher at the cinema. King George is imprisoned as Nullah is taken away. Sarah drives through crowds at Darwin harbor where troopships gather. Nullah joins other half-caste children being shipped out, heard by his grandfather. Sarah passes marching troops, and Nullah eyes a white boy. Troops crowd the wharf; Sarah exits her car. Callahan seizes the white boy as a priest takes Nullah. Fletcher, in crocodile boots, stands in front of Nullah. Sarah pushes through the wharf crowd as ships emit smoke. The priest leads Nullah to a boat while Fletcher watches. As Sarah runs, Nullah reaches the boat's stern. The small boat departs the liners evacuating the town. Nullah waves to Sarah, who stops at the wharf's end. Fletcher leans next to her as the boat sails away, grins, and leaves smugly. On the boat, Nullah looks at a priest as Sarah leans on the rail, crying. The children's boat sails away amid navy vessels. A Japanese fighter nears an island. Sarah steps onto the balcony, gazing over the harbor. She sees Drover by a tree; as he whistles, Magarri looks at him. Drover, uncomfortable, touches the tree, tears in his eyes. Their vehicles kick up dust across the river where they're camped. Clouds fill the sky as fighters launch from a carrier at dawn. Mission Island rests in the grey sea under cloudy skies. The children sleep in their dormitory when Nullah awakens suddenly. Fletcher, unpleasantly smiling, hangs up the phone in his office above Darwin.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Nullah stands still, staring intently into the vast distance, as Sarah arrives on horseback, approaching the house. At the same moment, Drover emerges from the house via the back door, and the sight of him makes her freeze momentarily, keeping her back deliberately turned towards him. On the porch, he rotates slowly and gazes at her intently before deciding to walk over to where Magarri stands with the horses. Her eyes fill with tears as she observes him. She quickly turns around and retreats back indoors just as Drover mounts a horse and rides away. 

Meanwhile, Nullah's loyal dog bravely attacks a policeman who is chasing him. Nullah pauses, turning slowly to meet the gaze of a half-naked black tracker. In a different location, Callahan catches up to Fletcher at the movies. Simultaneously, King George is forcefully thrown into a cell while Nullah is dragged away. Sarah is seen driving her car through dense crowds gathered at the bustling wharf, where numerous troopships are packed into Darwin harbor. Among the throng, Nullah is with a group of half-caste children who are being prepared for shipment as his grandfather hears about it from his cell. As Sarah navigates her vehicle past rows of marching soldiers, Nullah's focus is on a white boy nearby. 

The area is alive with activity as troops and civilians alike swarm toward the bustling wharf. Sarah is compelled to stop her car at a barrier and hurriedly gets out. Callahan takes hold of the white boy and pulls him away, while a priest simultaneously drags Nullah. A pair of crocodile-skin boots halts in front of Nullah, prompting him to look up into the face of Fletcher. Sarah, filled with anxious urgency, pushes her way through the crowd gathered on the busy wharf as thick smoke rises from the ships' funnels. The priest is leading Nullah to a boat that is waiting, while Fletcher watches the proceedings with a sly expression. As Sarah makes her way quickly down the wharf, Nullah runs to the back of the boat. The small boat then begins to pull away from the shadow of the colossal liners that are evacuating the town. 

Nullah looks up at Sarah from the boat, while Fletcher grins smugly. Nullah waves farewell to Sarah, who has stopped at the very edge of the wharf. Fletcher leans casually on the railing beside her as the boat continues its journey away. He turns to her, still grinning smugly, and then saunters off with an air of self-satisfaction. On the back of the departing boat, Nullah turns to look up at a priest, while Sarah leans heavily on the wharf rail, overwhelmed with despair as she struggles to contain her sobs. The children's boat makes its way away from the wharf, navigating between the enormous, grey naval vessels. In a different scene, a Japanese fighter jet zooms through the clouds towards an isolated island. 

Sarah steps gracefully onto the balcony, and her gaze extends across the harbor. She looks thoughtfully across the distance at Drover, who's standing pensively by a nearby tree. As he whistles softly, Magarri observes Drover, who appears uncomfortable and hesitantly places his hand on the tree. Magarri turns away, and tears well up in Drover's eyes, hinting at his inner turmoil. Their vehicles, moving in the distance, raise a cloud of dust on the far side of the river next to which they are camping. Above, the sky is filled with clouds as aircraft fighters take off at dawn from a massive aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits serenely in the grey sea beneath the overcast sky. Meanwhile, the children are peacefully asleep in their dormitory when Nullah awakens suddenly and with a start. In stark contrast, Fletcher is smiling unpleasantly as he hangs up the phone in his office, which overlooks the entire expanse of Darwin below.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Nullah stands motionless, his gaze fixed intently on the far-off horizon, as Sarah arrives on horseback, drawing closer to the house. At precisely the same moment, Drover steps out of the house through the back door, and the very sight of him causes her to pause in her tracks, keeping her back deliberately turned away from him. On the porch, Drover slowly turns and looks at her with deep intensity before ultimately choosing to walk over to the spot where Magarri stands with the horses. Meanwhile, Sarahâ€™s eyes fill with tears as she watches him, and she quickly turns around, retreating back indoors just as Drover mounts a horse and rides away from the scene.

In parallel, Nullah's loyal dog makes a fearless attempt to attack a policeman who is in pursuit of him. Nullah himself comes to a halt, turning slowly to meet the unwavering gaze of a half-naked black tracker. In a separate location, Callahan manages to catch up with Fletcher at the movies. At the same time, King George is violently thrown into a cell while Nullah is forcibly dragged away. Meanwhile, Sarah is seen driving her car through the throngs of dense crowds gathered at the bustling wharf, where numerous troopships have filled the Darwin harbor. Among the multitude of people, Nullah is with a group of half-caste children being prepared for shipment, even as his grandfather learns about the situation from his cell. As Sarah navigates her vehicle past rows of marching soldiers, Nullahâ€™s attention is drawn to a white boy nearby.

The area is alive and brimming with activity, as both troops and civilians flood toward the bustling wharf in great numbers. Sarah is compelled to stop her car at a barrier and hurriedly gets out to assess the situation. Concurrently, Callahan grabs hold of the white boy and pulls him aside, while a priest simultaneously drags Nullah away. A pair of crocodile-skin boots comes to a halt right in front of Nullah, prompting him to look up into the face of Fletcher. Sarah, driven by anxious urgency, pushes her way through the crowd gathered on the busy wharf, where thick smoke is rising from the ships' funnels. The priest continues to lead Nullah to a boat that is waiting, while Fletcher observes the proceedings with a sly expression on his face. As Sarah desperately makes her way quickly down the wharf, Nullah makes a dash to the back of the boat. The small boat then begins to pull away from the shadow of the immense liners that are evacuating the town.

Nullah looks up at Sarah from the departing boat, while Fletcher grins with smug satisfaction. Nullah waves farewell to Sarah, who has paused at the very edge of the wharf, filled with emotion. Fletcher leans casually on the railing beside her as the boat continues its journey away. He turns to her, maintaining his self-satisfied grin, before he saunters off with an air of casual self-assurance. On the back of the departing boat, Nullah turns to look up at the priest, while Sarah leans heavily on the wharf rail, overwhelmed with a sense of despair as she struggles to contain her sobs. The childrenâ€™s boat travels away from the wharf, navigating skillfully between the enormous, grey naval vessels. In an entirely different scene, a Japanese fighter jet zooms rapidly through the clouds as it makes its way toward an isolated island.

Sarah steps gracefully onto the balcony, and her gaze extends thoughtfully across the harbor. She looks across the distance with contemplation at Drover, who's standing pensively by a nearby tree. As he whistles gently, Magarri observes Drover, who appears uneasy and hesitantly places his hand on the tree beside him. Magarri turns away, and tears begin to well up in Drover's eyes, hinting at the inner turmoil he is experiencing. In the distance, vehicles are moving, raising a cloud of dust on the far side of the river next to which they are camped. Above, the sky is filled with clouds as aircraft fighters take off at dawn from a massive aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits serenely in the grey sea beneath the overcast sky. Meanwhile, the children are peacefully asleep in their dormitory when Nullah awakens suddenly and with a start. In stark contrast, Fletcher is smiling unpleasantly as he hangs up the phone in his office, which provides a sweeping view of the entire expanse of Darwin below.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Nullah fixes his gaze into the distant expanse as Sarah approaches the house on horseback. Meanwhile, Drover emerges from the back door, prompting Sarah to abruptly halt and keep her back turned to him, avoiding any interaction. As Drover reaches the porch, he pivots slowly, taking a deliberate moment to cast a lingering look at her before he continues his stride towards Magarri and the waiting horses. Sarahâ€™s emotions swell, evident in her eyes brimming with tears, compelling her to spin on her heel and retreat back inside the house as Drover mounts a horse and rides away. In a different scene, Nullah's dog aggressively intercepts a police officer giving chase to him, and Nullah gradually turns his head to meet the gaze of a half-naked black tracker. Concurrently, Callahan discovers Fletcher amidst the dim ambiance of the movie theater. In a stark turn of events, King George is violently thrown into a prison cell as Nullah is forcibly taken away. Meanwhile, Sarah navigates her vehicle through the bustling crowds gathered on the wharf, where troopships densely line the Darwin harbor. In this chaotic environment, Nullah is clustered among a group of half-caste children being herded onto ships, while his grandfather from within his cell becomes aware of the situation. Sarahâ€™s car journeys past rows of disciplined, marching soldiers, with Nullahâ€™s eyes fixed intently on a white boy present among them. As both military personnel and civilians surge toward the wharf, Sarah halts her car at a barrier, promptly stepping out. In the ensuing commotion, Callahan forcibly pulls the white boy away as a priest seizes Nullah. The sight of crocodile-skin boots halting before him draws Nullahâ€™s gaze upward to confront Fletcher's face, now looming above him. With urgency, Sarah pushes her way through the dense throng of people on the wharf, against the backdrop of shipsâ€™ funnels releasing plumes of smoke. Meanwhile, the priest escorts Nullah toward a boat poised to depart as Fletcher watches with cunning interest. As Sarah dashes down the length of the wharf, Nullah breaks free from the priestâ€™s grip, sprinting to the stern of the boat. The small vessel, separating from the shadows cast by the massive liners evacuating the harbor, gradually makes its way out to sea. From aboard, Nullah looks up at Sarah, their eyes meeting as Fletcher smirks observantly. Nullah raises a hand, waving to Sarah, who has come to a stop at the wharf's edge. Beside her, Fletcher leans nonchalantly on the railing, exchanging a smug look with her before jauntily walking away. As the boat retreats further, Nullah remains at the back, casting a final look up at the priest, while Sarah clings to the wharf railing in a state of desolation, attempting to stifle her sobs. The children's boat continues its path between towering, grey navy vessels. Overhead, a Japanese fighter plane skims ominously through the clouds, heading toward an undisclosed island. On a balcony, overlooking the scene, Sarah steps out and surveys the harbor, her eyes eventually finding Drover, who stands contemplatively beside a tree. As he begins to whistle, Magarriâ€™s stare fixes on Drover, whose discomfort is palpable as he hesitantly places a hand on the tree, prompting Magarri to turn away, leaving Drover alone with tears pooling in his eyes. In the meantime, on the opposite riverbank where they have made camp, vehicles kick up a trail of dust into the air. As dawn breaks, clouds crowd the sky while fighter planes launch from an aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits serenely beneath the overcast sky, cradled by the grey sea. Inside a dormitory on the island, children lie peacefully asleep until Nullah suddenly awakens, startled from his slumber. Elsewhere, Fletcher, with a sardonic smile etched across his face, replaces the phone receiver in his office, which offers a commanding view of the entirety of Darwin.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Nullah gazes into the distance as Sarah arrives at the house, and Drover exits the back door, causing her to freeze and keep her back to him. On the porch, he looks at her, then moves toward Magarri and the horses while her eyes fill with tears, prompting her to turn and return indoors as he departs. Meanwhile, Nullah's dog attacks a pursuing cop, and Nullah faces a half-naked black tracker. Callahan encounters Fletcher at the movies. King George is imprisoned as Nullah is taken away. Sarah drives through the throngs at the wharf, crowded with troopships in Darwin harbor. Nullah, among other half-caste children being relocated, is separated from his grandfather in a cell. As Sarah drives past marching troops, Nullah observes a white boy. As troops and civilians flock to the wharf, Sarah stops at a barrier and exits her car. Callahan removes the white boy and a priest leads Nullah away as Fletcher watches. Crocodile boots stop before him, and Nullah meets Fletcher's gaze. Sarah anxiously threads through the crowd as smoke billows from ships. The priest guides Nullah to a waiting boat while Fletcher observes slyly. As Sarah rushes to the wharf, Nullah races to the boat's stern as it pulls away from the liners evacuating the town. Nullah waves to Sarah, who stops at the wharf's end with Fletcher smugly nearby, grinning before leaving. On the boat, Nullah looks up at a priest while Sarah, leaning on the wharf rail, struggles with despair. The children's boat departs between vast navy vessels. A Japanese fighter approaches an island through the clouds. Sarah emerges onto the balcony, looking over the harbor and toward Drover, standing pensively by a tree. As he whistles, Magarri watches Drover, who, uncomfortable, rests his hand on the tree, prompting Magarri to turn away while tears well in Drover's eyes. Vehicles raise dust across the river by their camp. Clouds gather as fighters launch from an aircraft carrier at dawn, and Mission Island sits silently beneath the cloudy sky. In the dormitory, children sleep as Nullah awakens abruptly. Fletcher, grinning unpleasantly, hangs up the phone in his office overlooking Darwin.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Nullah, a young Aboriginal boy with a deep connection to his heritage, stares into the distance as Sarah rides up to the house on her old mare, which had been a gift from her father, a local rancher. Drover, known throughout the region as a rugged cattle driver, comes out the back door, and she freezes, keeping her back to him. On the porch, built from native timber by local craftsmen, he turns slowly and looks at her, then walks towards Magarri and the horses, who are tethered under the shade of a wide eucalyptus, as her eyes fill with tears. She whirls around and goes back indoors as he rides away towards the open plains. Nullah's dog, a loyal Australian Kelpie, attacks a cop chasing him during his escape from capture, and he turns slowly to look into the eyes of a half-naked black tracker, a man skilled in bushcraft and often employed by the authorities to find escaped convicts. Callahan finds Fletcher at the movies in Darwinâ€™s historic cinema, which had recently survived a cyclone. King George, a respected elder known for his wisdom, is flung into a cell as Nullah is dragged away in a harsh crackdown on mixed-race children. Sarah drives through crowds on the wharf where troopships, some of which had traveled all the way from Sydney, crowd Darwin harbor. Nullah is with a group of half-caste children, who were often forcefully taken from their families as part of the Stolen Generations policy, being shipped out as his grandfather hears in his cell. Sarah drives past lines of marching troops, a sign of the escalating tensions of World War II, while Nullah stares at the white boy, a child of a local dairy farmer. Troops and civilians swarm towards the wharf, and Sarah stops at a barrier, erected by local authorities for crowd control, and gets out of the car. Callahan drags the white boy away as a priest pulls Nullah, who is one of many taken to Christian missions. Crocodile boots, a luxury item made from the leather of reptiles found in Northern Australia, stop in front of him, and Nullah looks up into Fletcher's face. Sarah barges her way anxiously through the crowd on the wharf as smoke rises from ships' funnels, signaling their imminent departure. The priest, a member of a missionary group known for their work in the outback, leads Nullah to a waiting boat while Fletcher observes slyly, knowing the pain he's caused. As Sarah runs down the wharf, Nullah runs to the stern of the boat. The small boat pulls out of the shadow of the huge liners evacuating the town, which is bracing for a possible Japanese attack. The boy looks up at Sarah, and Fletcher grins triumphantly. Nullah waves to Sarah, who stops at the end of the wharf. Fletcher leans on the railing next to her as the boat sails away into the open ocean. He turns smugly to her, grins, and saunters off with an air of victory. On the back of the boat, Nullah turns and looks up at a priest, who is known for his stern demeanor, as Sarah leans on the wharf rail in despair, trying to control her sobs. The children's boat sails away from the wharf between huge, grey navy vessels, part of the fleet assembled to defend the coastline. A Japanese fighter, one of many patrolling the skies, skims through the clouds towards an island in the Pacific. Sarah steps out onto the balcony of her wood-paneled room and looks out over the harbor. She looks across at Drover, who's standing thoughtfully by a tree, a remnant of the mangrove forest that used to thrive in the region. As he whistles, Magarri stares at Drover, who looks uncomfortable and tentatively lays his hand on the tree. Magarri turns away, conscious of the cultural importance of trees in his heritage, and tears fill Drover's eyes. Their vehicles, rugged trucks built for the harsh terrain, raise a cloud of dust on the other side of the river they are camping next to. Clouds fill the sky as fighters take off at dawn from an aircraft carrier, ready to face the impending threat. Mission Island sits peacefully in the grey sea, beneath the cloudy sky, a picture of serenity amid turmoil. The children are asleep in their dormitory, made of corrugated iron to withstand the elements, when Nullah wakes up with a start. Smiling unpleasantly, Fletcher hangs up the phone in his office overlooking the whole of Darwin, confident in his manipulative schemes.

Nullah is with a group of halfcaste children being shipped out as his grandfather hears in his cell. Sarah drives past lines of marching troops while Nullah stares at the white boy. Troops and civilians swarm towards the wharf and Sarah stops at a barrier and gets out of the car. Callahan drags the white boy away as a priest pulls Nullah. Crocodile boots stop in front of him and Nullah looks up into Fletcher's face. Sarah barges her way anxiously through the crowd on the wharf as smoke rises from ships' funnels. The small boat pulls out of the shadow of the huge liners evacuating the town. The boy looks up at Sarah and Fletcher grins. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. Nullah waves to Sarah who stops at the end of the wharf. Fletcher leans on the railing next to her as the boat sails away. He turns smugly to her grins and saunters off. On the back of the boat. Nullah turns and looks up at a priest as Sarah leans on the wharf rail in despair trying to control her sobs. The children's boat sails away from the wharf between huge grey navy vessels. A Japanese fighter skims through the clouds towards an island. Sarah steps out onto the balcony and looks out over the harbor. She looks across at Drover who is standing thoughtfully by a tree. As he whistles Magarri stares at Drover who looks uncomfortable and tentatively lays his hand on the tree. Magarri turns away and tears fill Drover's eyes. Their vehicles raise a cloud of dust on the other side of the river. they are camping next to. Clouds fill the sky as fighters take off at dawn from an aircraft carrier. Mission Island sits peacefully in the grey sea beneath the cloudy sky. The children are asleep in their dormitory when Nullah wakes up with a start. Smiling unpleasantly. Fletcher hangs up the phone in his office overlooking the whole of Darwin.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Concrete ponders into the abyss as Juniper cycles up to the library. Wanderer steps out the front gate, and she halts, keeping her front to it. On the veranda, it pivots gradually and gazes at her, then walks towards Umbra and the bicycles as her feet flood with rain. She spins around and retreats back outdoors as it cycles away. Concrete's cat pounces on a teacher chasing it, and it pivots gradually to gaze into the eyes of a fully-clothed white carpenter. Callahan discovers Walker at the concert. Queen Georgia is tossed into a garage as Concrete is pulled away. Juniper pedals through flocks on the bridge where sailboats cram Byron bay. Flamingo heels halt in front of it, and Concrete gazes up into Walkerâ€™s toes. Juniper nudges her way cheerfully through the forest on the bridge as fog descends from treesâ€™ branches. The singer guides Concrete to a waiting bus while Walker monitors craftily. As Juniper sprints down the bridge, Concrete dashes to the bow of the bus. The large bus rolls into the brightness of the giant bicycles importing the farm. The frog peers up at Juniper, and Walker laughs. Concrete signals to Juniper, who halts at the start of the bridge. Walker leans on the barricade next to her as the bus cruises away. It pivots arrogantly to her, chuckles, and strides off. On the top of the bus, Concrete pivots and gazes up at a singer as Juniper leans on the bridge fence in delight, trying to manage her cheers. The ducksâ€™ bus drifts towards the bridge beside tiny, black commercial ships. An Italian submarine glides through the water towards a peninsula. Juniper moves out onto the rooftop and gazes out over the bay. She gazes across at Wanderer, whoâ€™s sitting joyfully by a flower. As it hums, Umbra glares at Wanderer, who feels thrilled and eagerly places its foot on the flower. Umbra pivots towards, and sunlight fills Wandererâ€™s face. Their airplanes raise a blanket of steam on the same side of the mountain they are picnicking next to. Mist empties the land as submarines dive off at night from a space station. Operation Mountain lies chaotically in the black sand, above the clear land. The dogs are awake in their classroom when Concrete dozes off with a rest. Frowning gladly, Walker adjusts the light in its tower overlooking the park of Byron.

The sailor directs Balloon to an idling van while Turner watches slyly. As Laura rushes down the pier, Balloon dashes to the bow of the van. The diminutive van rolls out of the cloak of the gigantic cruise ships abandoning the city. The girl peers down at Laura, and Turner chuckles. Balloon flutters to Laura, who rests at the tip of the pier. Turner lounges on the barricade beside her as the van glides away. He swivels arrogantly to her, chuckles, and struts off. On the roof of the van, Balloon pivots and peers up at a sailor as Laura leans on the pier fence in anguish, striving to contain her hollers. The penguins' van glides away from the pier amidst colossal, rusty cargo freighters. An American glider drifts under the fog towards a peninsula. Laura emerges onto the terrace and peers out over the bay. She peers across at Trader, who's standing pensively by a bush. As he hums, Jingo gazes at Trader, who feels awkward and gingerly places his foot on the bush. Jingo swivels away, and rain fills Trader's vision. Their bicycles kick up a mist of confetti on the far side of the gorge they are picnicking beside. Fog fills the atmosphere as gliders soar at dusk from a naval base. Sanctuary Isle floats silently in the rusty ocean, beneath the foggy atmosphere. The penguins are napping in their nursery when Balloon jolts awake with a shiver. Grinning coldly, Turner disconnects the telegram in his workshop overlooking the entirety of Sydney.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Nullah gazes as Sarah arrives. Drover appears, causing her to pause, and tears fill her eyes as he leaves. Nullah's dog fends off a cop, and Nullah encounters a black tracker. King George is jailed while Nullah is taken away. Sarah drives through Darwin's crowded harbor, witnessing Nullah among half-caste children being shipped out. In the chaos, Callahan and a priest separate the children, with Fletcher observing slyly. Sarah anxiously pushes through the crowd but arrives too late to stop the boat carrying Nullah. As the boat departs, Fletcher smugly watches Sarah's despair. A Japanese fighter approaches an island while Sarah looks over the harbor and Drover across the water. Drover, emotional, stands by a tree with Magarri. Fighters take off at dawn, and children sleep on Mission Island. Nullah awakens with alarm, while Fletcher smiles unpleasantly in his office overlooking Darwin.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Fletcher hangs up the phone in his office overlooking the whole of Darwin Smiling unpleasantly The children are asleep in their dormitory when Nullah wakes up with a start Mission Island sits peacefully in the grey sea beneath the cloudy sky Clouds fill the sky as fighters take off at dawn from an aircraft carrier they are camping next to Their vehicles raise a cloud of dust on the other side of the river Magarri turns away and tears fill Drover's eyes As he whistles Magarri stares at Drover who looks uncomfortable and tentatively lays his hand on the tree She looks across at Drover who is standing thoughtfully by a tree Sarah steps out onto the balcony and looks out over the harbor A Japanese fighter skims through the clouds towards an island The children's boat sails away from the wharf between huge grey navy vessels Nullah turns and looks up at a priest as Sarah leans on the wharf rail in despair trying to control her sobs On the back of the boat He turns smugly to her grins and saunters off Fletcher leans on the railing next to her as the boat sails away Nullah waves to Sarah who stops at the end of the wharf The boy looks up at Sarah and Fletcher grins The small boat pulls out of the shadow of the huge liners evacuating the town As Sarah runs down the wharf Nullah runs to the stern of the boat The priest leads Nullah to a waiting boat while Fletcher observes slyly Sarah barges her way anxiously through the crowd on the wharf as smoke rises from ships' funnels Crocodile boots stop in front of him and Nullah looks up into Fletcher's face Callahan drags the white boy away as a priest pulls Nullah Troops and civilians swarm towards the wharf and Sarah stops at a barrier and gets out of the car Sarah drives past lines of marching troops while Nullah stares at the white boy Nullah is with a group of halfcaste children being shipped out as his grandfather hears in his cell Sarah drives through crowds on the wharf where troopships crowd Darwin harbor King George is flung into a cell as Nullah is dragged away Callahan finds Fletcher at the movies Nullah's dog attacks a cop chasing him and he turns slowly to look into the eyes of a halfnaked black tracker She whirls around and goes back indoors as he rides away On the porch he turns slowly and looks at her then walks towards Magarri and the horses as her eyes fill with tears Drover comes out the back door and she freezes keeping her back to him Nullah stares into the distance as Sarah rides up to the house
